data.text: In Ethiopia, @AminaJMohammed spent the week meeting with school children, healthcare workers, displaced people & others affected by conflict, the climate emergency & devastating humanitarian crises gripping the country. https://t.co/zBEW3Sh0PO

From mangroves shielding coastlines to peatlands locking up carbon, ecosystems are vital for our environment.

We all have a role to play in stopping the spread of harmful misinformation online, which can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable during a crisis like #COVID19.

On Tuesday's Safer Internet Day, #PledgetoPause before sharing. https://t.co/qFqoh7loX2 https://t.co/rVVZclwImm

It takes less than a minute to write a comment that can have a big impact on someone’s mental health and well-being.

A kinder Internet starts with you.

Tuesday is #SaferInternetDay. https://t.co/C3BEGqOI5I via @UNICEF https://t.co/zuo5VrhHf5

Cyberbullying could be happening in your home, right now. 

On Tuesday's #SaferInternetDay, @UNICEF has tips on how to keep your child safe online, during and beyond #COVID19. https://t.co/FSE4I9botN https://t.co/iz6cXnaJ3i

Compared to 3 decades ago, girls today are 1/3 less likely to be subjected to female genital mutilation (FGM).

Scary. Painful. Traumatizing.

That’s how female genital mutilation (FGM) survivors describe their experience. 

Sunday is #EndFMG Day.

More from @UNFPA. https://t.co/xicMqnjsj2 https://t.co/I3w4uzc8Ye

Why should you care about what's happening in the Arctic?

Because it impacts the entire planet.🌍

Without #ClimateAction, thawing permafrost could release dangerous microorganisms & carbon emissions that have been locked in ice for thousands of years. 
https://t.co/PMalyx3NAD
